content: "With a private security officer assisting, Sheikh Issa bin Zayed al Nahyan is seen stuffing sand in the Afghan's mouth. As the grain dealer pleads and whimpers, he is beaten with a nailed board, burned in the genitals with a cigarette lighter, shocked with a cattle prod, and led to believe he would be shot. Salt is poured on his wounds. In the end, the victim can muster up only weak moans as an SUV is repeatedly driven over him". "http://www.cnn.com/2009/CRIME/04/30/uae.torture/index.html
reply: "With a private security officer assisting, Sheikh Issa bin Zayed al Nahyan is seen stuffing sand in the Afghan's mouth. As the grain dealer pleads and whimpers, he is beaten with a nailed board, burned in the genitals with a cigarette lighter, shocked with a cattle prod, and led to believe he would be shot. Salt is poured on his wounds. In the end, the victim can muster up only weak moans as an SUV is repeatedly driven over him". "http://www.cnn.com/2009/CRIME/04/30/uae.torture/index.html
title: Man is lucky not to be waterboarded

Respectfully, SUNLINER81 I don't need your approval or disapproval for posting. Get off my ass!
title: Man is lucky not to be waterboarded

One of the nice things about our country, is that no one has to prove the obvious. We don't need to run story after story, to convince Americans that this is WRONG. No one needs to run story after story "Proving" that Al Qaeda is evil but when an American tortures people it is. Dog bites man is no story at all. Which is why you don't see to much coverage of the million or so dog biting incidents that occur each year. Dave
